images may be reproduced altered or distributed in any form you are free to sell what you make from this pattern page 1 ribbed cowl pattern i love three button cowls they are so versatile because they can be worn in so many different ways this pattern works up very quickly but i think it really makes a statement the cowl is simply a rectangle with three buttons sewn on materials drops andes yarn 2 skeins for an adult sized cowl 9mm m/n hook three 38mm buttons i used coconut shell buttons tapestry needle gauge not critical for this pattern i go more by measurements than by count skill level easy abbreviations used chain chain foundation half_double_crochet fhdc foundation single_crochet fsc front loop only flo half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet stitch st pattern notes this really is more of a recipe than a strict pattern i give you the number of stitches in each row and the number of row that i did but you can certainly increase or decrease either of them to change the size you can also use a different type/weight of yarn and adjust the hook accordingly i prefer a bulky or super bulky yarn for these cowls simply because it makes them extra squishy and cozy the yarn that i use stretches out quite a bit when blocked if you are using a different yarn that does not stretch a lot you will want to take that into account i like my finished cowl to be 34-36 long determined by the number of stitches in each row and 11-12 wide determined by the number of row the chains at the beginning of row do not count as stitches i crochet this cowl quite loosely you want good drape so you don t want tight stitches if you tend to crochet tightly you may consider going up a hook size page 2 pattern row 1 work 72 fsc 72 or as many as it takes to make it the length you would like your cowl turn after blocking i like my cowl to be 35 inches long which means before blocking it s usually around 30 if you would like to see a tutorial on fsc both video and photo moogly blog has a great one here if you would prefer not to do fsc you can chain 73 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook and every other chain 72 row 2 chain 2 in flo half_double_crochet across turn 72 see pictures 1-6 on pages 4 and 5 for more details row 3 chain 1 in 3rd loop single_crochet across turn 72 see pictures 1-6 on pages 4 and 5 for more details row 4-18 repeat row 2 & 3 alternating end on a row 2 you can make it wider by doing more
